√bādh 'oppress'

present: [1.] bā́dhate etc. V.+  bā́dhati etc. E.+  

perfect: babādhé V.+  babādha?  

aorist: [3.] ababādhat   -- [5.] bādhiṣṭa  bādhithās  bādhiṣṭām  

future: [1.] bādhiṣyati  bādhiṣyate   -- [2.] bādhitā  

verbal: bādhitá V.+  bādhitum  -bā́dhya  bā́dhe  

secondary: passive: bādhyate etc. E.+   -- intensive: bābadhe  bā́badhāna  badbadhé  badbadhāná   -- desiderative: bībhatsate etc. V.+  bibādhiṣate   -- causative: bādhayati etc. AV.+  

derivatives: bādh  bādhá V.+  bādhā́ V.+  bādhaka E.+  -bādhin B.C.  bādhyà B.+  bādhana E.+  bādhanīya C.  -bā́dhas RV.  bādhitavya E.+  bādhitṛ E.+  bībhatsa S.+  bībhatsā́ B.  bībhatsú V.+  bādhayitṛ C.  

Compare √vadh, badh. The reference of bībhatsa- to this root is not beyond question.
